I hope you feel better soon.  I just made a block buster chicken soup from =
scratch to bring to my friend's mom who was also  not feeling well.  And if=
 you have someone to make it for you, here's what you do.

Ingredients:  On=
e whole chicken, three to four onions, a handful of parsley, five of six ca=
rrots, several stalks of celery, and a pinch of salt, according to your tas=
te.

Put the whole chicken in a large soup pot, and pour just enough water =
over the chicken to cover it.  Then add onions, carrots, celery and then se=
ason with salt according to your own taste.  Start the soup on high until i=
t begins to boil, then lower to a slow to steady simmer for two to three ho=
urs or until the legs of the chicken are loose.  * Just lift the chicken ou=
t of the pot with a pair of tongs and jiggle the legs* .  Once the legs are=
 loose, you're ready to take the meat and veggies out of the soup.  First d=
iscard the parsley, which is only there for flavor, then in a sparate mixin=
g bowl, you add the veggies and on a platter you put the chicken.  Allow me=
at and veggies to cool and then start by cutting the veggies into bite size=
d pieces and put them back into the broth of the soup.  Then you take the c=
hicken off the bones, discard skin, fat and bones, and shred the meat into =
bite sized pieces and put that back into the soup.  Once this is done, turn=
 off the heat and allow the soup to cool. Once it cools down the fat will r=
ise to the top and it will solidify.  When you're ready to eat it, just ski=
m the top of the soup and remove the fat.  Heat to desired temperature slow=
ly and boil up your favorite pasta and most importantly, ENJOY.

This is ou=
r family recipe that comes straight from Florence, Italy.  Trust me, you'll=
 love it.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wro=
te:
>
> OOC - Sorry for the lack of posting, running a fever and so I fear =
I won't be super active until it passes.  Thanks for understanding!
